author: JeremyLoy
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```bash
brew cask install powershell
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

powershell is installed successfully

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Expected: 396bbb5907fd0ec0bdfbfe0bf01961b52b4f1f1ceddc95467dd9ecd4fa5281df
Actual:   74c4d1ba68958df7630327c3ea0c3b9c40181fd748b82738b54941a6863e3859
```

Earlier this week, I successfully installed powershell on my work Macbook using homebrew.
Today, however, I am getting a shasum mismatch.

It seems that the `6.0.0` release and tag were updated 21 hours ago, due to the OSX binary not being correctly signed. 

The homebrew repo was not updated accordingly.
title: Checksum Mismatch with Homebrew installation
